title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 11 June 2013 - XWiki
content:
<abusenius\_> has quit  
00:25 <kstuart> has quit  
00:54 <kstuart> has joined #xwiki  
01:26 <Denis1> has quit  
01:56 <xwikibot> has joined #xwiki  
02:14 <chalx> has quit  
04:10 <kstuart> has quit  
04:30 <Denis1> has joined #xwiki  
05:51 <Denis1> has quit  
07:29 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
07:50 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
08:02 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
08:12 <vmassol> good morning  
08:13 <vmassol> I was surprised to see we have not that much listed in http://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/ReleaseNotes/ReleaseNotesXWiki51M2 Is that really all we have?  
08:30 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki  
09:10 <gdelhumeau> has joined #xwiki  
09:27 <evalica> has quit  
09:32 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
09:37 <sburjan> has joined #xwiki  
09:38 <chalx> has joined #xwiki  
10:18 <sburjan> vmassol: g ood morning. I find the documentation on Clustering very incomplete. I either have to read about clustering in general, or this page is totally incomplete: http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/AdminGuide/Clustering .I won't be able tosetup a XWiki in cluster only with this, sorry  
10:20 <vmassol> sburjan: you forgot to click on the links  
10:21 <vmassol> I've checked and this page has everything you need AFAICS  
10:21 <sburjan> well in the first place I don't quite see a description on how clustering works with XWiki  
10:22 <sburjan> or if I am a begginner (like me) .. what is clustering and why I'd need it  
10:22 <sburjan> also, the documentation from JGroups seems a mess too :)  
10:24 <vmassol> sburjan: the question is not wheher the doc is perfect or not  
10:24 <vmassol> you can improve it later  
10:24 <vmassol> it's whether you can use it, and it's very clear to me  
10:24 <vmassol> it has very specific step by step details  
10:24 <vmassol> so you should definitely be able to use it  
10:25 <sburjan> I only see 2 steps .. Please note that I don't have your experience so it's harder for me to understand what is going on there  
10:25 <vmassol> sburjan: can you please read the full page  
10:25 <vmassol> and not just portions  
10:25 <vmassol> hat's the problem with this link "Follow the http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/AdminGuide/DistributedEventClusterSetup for a complete tutorial on how to setup a simple cluster between two instances of XWiki on the same server."  
10:25 <vmassol> ?  
10:25 <vmassol> if you can't do this then sorry but it's pretty simple...  
10:26 <vmassol> and it's pretty well described hwat clustering is  
10:26 <vmassol> "The goal of a cluster of XWiki instance is to provide several XWiki in different servers accessing the same database server to be able to do load balancing."  
10:26 <vmassol> so I think you're really not hepling yourself  
10:26 <vmassol> :(  
10:28 <vmassol> again, the doc is pretty bad in consistency and organization  
10:28 <vmassol> I definitely agree  
10:28 <vmassol> but if you read it you should be able to set it up easily  
10:29 <sburjan> yes, I didn't got reading till the end of the doc, where the link to the tutorial was  
10:30 <Denis1> has joined #xwiki  
10:30 <Denis1> is now known as <Denis>  
10:58 <msmeria> has joined #xwiki  
11:06 <vmassol> tmortagne: do you have a solution to progress on the solr issue raised yesterday for M2?  
11:06 <vmassol> XWIKI-9217 ?  
11:07 <tmortagne> that's one aspect but the main issue raised by sorin if that he could not find standard pages and he not find standard pages because the UI search for en locale and standard pages don't have any locale  
11:08 <vmassol> couldn't pages with no locale be returned too?  
11:09 <tmortagne> sure they could but that's something for the thread I started  
11:09 <vmassol> I'm just worried that this thread might take a long time to stabilize because it seems the issue is complex  
11:09 <tmortagne> it is complex  
11:10 <vmassol> so I was wondering if there was a way to make it acceptable for now so that we can release M2 and then make changes later depending on the result of the thread  
11:10 <tmortagne> so for M2 we need to decide what exactly we want the behavior to be, do we want to find all default pages, only the one containing real english etc  
11:11 <Denis> just sent my position on the ML  
11:11 <tmortagne> in practice SOLR is still experimental so it not like it was supposed to block this release  
11:11 <vmassol> reading  
11:11 <tmortagne> we could simply go for the release  
11:12 <vmassol> well if nothing is returned it's an issue since our goal is to have solr ready by the end of 5.1 and we want users to start testing it  
11:12 <tmortagne> vmassol: it's not nothing and the standard pages  
11:13 <vmassol> s/and/only ?  
11:13 <tmortagne> yes  
11:13 <tmortagne> the issue is pretty simple: the UI search for en and standard pages are not en  
11:14 <tmortagne> when you create a new page it gets the default language which mean en if you don't change the settings  
11:14 <tmortagne> so you find it when searching  
11:15 <altker1281> has joined #xwiki  
12:25 <Slashman> has joined #xwiki  
12:34 <sburjan> vmassol: ping  
12:35 <vmassol> sburjan: yes?  
12:35 <sburjan> vmassol: could you create test.xwiki.org so I can deploy ?  
12:35 <vmassol> so we agree about the name in the end? didn't check the thread  
12:36 <vmassol> ok just read it  
12:36 <vmassol> it's ok, we can change later on if need be  
12:36 <vmassol> creating  
12:37 <sburjan> vmassol: I agree about what you said. I will put a clear description on the homepage so there will be no confusion about the name  
12:38 <vmassol> sburjan: you didn't say so in the thread though  
12:38 <sburjan> vmassol: replying now  
12:38 <vmassol> ok thanks  
12:38 <vmassol> hmm  
12:38 <vmassol> seems I cannot create a wiki  
12:39 <vmassol> tmortagne: I think it's the "too many users" issue  
12:39 <vmassol> maybe someone updated xwiki.org without taking care of the change  
12:40 <vmassol> which would be "normal" since it doesn't seem to be documented  
12:40 <vmassol> tmortagne: but wasn't the wiki manager app updated to use the new user/group controls?  
12:42 <vmassol> I see we're using Wiki Manager Application 4.5.2  
12:42 <vmassol> tmortagne: would you remember the part that I have to change?  
12:43 <vmassol> trying to comment out the printUsersAndGroups macro  
12:44 <vmassol> works :)  
12:48 <sburjan> guys, any idea why mvn xar:format puts a <template/> tag in my xml files ?  
12:52 <sburjan> vmassol: tell me when you are finished  
12:52 <vmassol> sure  
12:52 <vmassol> it's not easy  
12:52 <vmassol> trying to figure out how to install a new wiki  
12:53 <sburjan> yes ...  
12:53 <vmassol> tmortagne/mflorea: any idea why I don't get the DW for the new wiki?  
12:53 <vmassol> it's the issue fixed by thomas not long ago maybe  
12:53 <vmassol> so maybe I'd need a restart of xwiki.org?  
13:08 <tmortagne> vmassol: it's possible xwiki.org is confured to have DW only on main wiki  
13:09 <vmassol> tmortagne: I tried to force it but got https://www.evernote.com/shard/s119/sh/d8f9d6a7-6a95-4c57-9269-09859c771775/d90825933b898ca4593204a201a65424 ;)  
13:09 <tmortagne> vmassol: what do you mean by force it ?  
13:09 <vmassol> use the distribution action...  
13:10 <tmortagne> this action does not do anything, it just access the DW job is one exists  
13:10 <vmassol> is there a way to trigger it?  
13:10 <tmortagne> I guess mflorea did not do anything to have a nice display when no job is running  
13:10 <tmortagne> vmassol: not by hand no  
13:11 <tmortagne> tmortagne: xwiki.org is 4.5.2  
13:11 <tmortagne> there is no wiki DW before 5.0  
13:11 <mflorea> yes  
13:11 <tmortagne> vmassol:  
13:12 <vmassol> so my choice is to install manually the admin application XAR to try to get the EM UI  
13:12 <vmassol> right?  
13:12 <mflorea> admin + em  
13:12 <tmortagne> vmassol: why didn't you created the wiki from a template ?  
13:12 <vmassol> there's no template  
13:12 <vmassol> :)  
13:12 <mflorea> indeed  
13:12 <mflorea> there should be one  
13:12 <vmassol> where?  
13:13 <vmassol> we have the xwikiorgflavor for that  
13:13 <tmortagne> I see that the standard tamplate hasn't been created on xwiki.org  
13:13 <tmortagne> s/tamplate/template/  
13:13 <vmassol> http://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/WikiManager/WebHome  
13:13 <mflorea> ah, we have a template only for playground  
13:14 <vmassol> yes  
13:14 <tmortagne> yes  
13:14 <vmassol> and it's not ready  
13:14 <tmortagne> and I don't think we are still using it  
13:14 <vmassol> it's something in progress, not used ATM  
13:14 <vmassol> yep  
13:15 <vmassol> mflorea: I guess we don't have a xwikiorg-subwiki-all flavor  
13:15 <mflorea> that's bad! why would we need that?  
13:15 <vmassol> for me to import the xar :)  
13:15 <mflorea> no, it's very bad for upgrading  
13:15 <vmassol> I didn't say for upgrading  
13:16 <vmassol> I'm just stuck ATM  
13:16 <mflorea> yes, but you'll have to upgrade that wiki  
13:16 <vmassol> will try admin + em XARs, not sure they're enough though  
13:16 <vmassol> they may have deps  
13:16 <mflorea> you need to create a template wiki, import the admin + em jars, then install xwikiorg subwiki flavor, then use the templat to create a new wiki  
13:17 <vmassol> no need for a template  
13:17 <mflorea> so that you don't repeat this whenever you create a new wiki  
13:17 <vmassol> since we have the flavor now  
13:17 <vmassol> we just need xwik.org to be updated  
13:17 <vmassol> no?  
13:19 <tmortagne> mflorea: yes  
13:20 <tmortagne> any extension installed on the template will be seen as installed in the new wiki too  
13:21 <mflorea> vmassol: yes, but http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-9158 is still open, and we have upgrade mode set to allwikis on xwiki.org because the entire farm is managed by a single entity, us.  
13:22 <vmassol> mflorea: ok, we need to fix this one then. Luckily we don't create new wikis every day on xwiki.org  
13:24 <mflorea> and I don't know how to set, if it's possible, xwikiorg subwiki flavor as default ui for subwikis, instead of enterprise-ui  
13:25 <vmassol> fun… :)  
13:54 <vmassol> sburjan: the wiki is created  
13:55 <vmassol> (you have a lock in the admin btw so you seem to be looking at it already ;))  
13:55 <sburjan> vmassol,: trying to install the application now. Let's hope I won't hit any issue  
13:55 <sburjan> I am alreadyt here :P  
13:55 <sburjan> fingers crossed :)  
13:55 <vmassol> evalica: ping  
13:55 <evalica> vmassol: pong  
13:56 <sburjan> vmassol: install seems successful. Installing tests  
13:56 <vmassol> evalica: you think you could help us have a color theme for test.xwiki.org?  
13:57 <sburjan> evalica: could you help me chosing the color ? I have exactly one in mind :)  
13:57 <evalica> vmassol: I think we should reuse one from xoffice or xeclipse and just change the logos - let me see  
13:58 <sburjan> vmassol: should I put a redirect from Main.WebHome to QA.WebHome ?  
13:58 <vmassol> sburjan: your choice, you just need to be sure the home page clearly explains what this wiki is and is nice looking  
13:59 <vmassol> (I don't know what information you have on QA.Webhome)  
13:59 <sburjan> ok  
13:59 <vmassol> QA is a bad name BTW  
13:59 <vmassol> it's not about QA  
13:59 <vmassol> it's about Testing only  
13:59 <vmassol> it's not a QA app  
13:59 <vmassol> it's a Test Reporting app  
14:00 <vmassol> )  
14:00 <vmassol> :-)  
14:00 <sburjan> :)  
14:15 <sburjan> thanks vmassol !  
14:16 <vmassol> sburjan: you should link to  e.x.o on the home page  
14:16 <vmassol> on "Test Reporting Application"  
14:16 <sburjan> yes, I was doing this right now  
14:16 <vmassol> also it's not just manual tests  
14:16 <vmassol> it's the full list of tests no?  
14:16 <vmassol> also it's supposed to be used by anyone no?  
14:17 <vmassol> sburjan: you should use preview  
14:17 <vmassol> hint: remove the "+"  
14:17 <sburjan> vmassol: thanks  
14:18 <sburjan> vmassol: it's the full list of Manual tests, we haven't integrated yet \_all\_ the tests  
14:18 <sburjan> by all = also \_all\_ the automated ones  
14:18 <vmassol> so "a better visibility on the manual tests for XWiki" is not correct  
14:18 <vmassol> you need to be more specific  
14:19 <sburjan> but it is the full list of Manual tests + some which are automated  
14:19 <vmassol> explain that it allows testers (anyone who want to help FTM) to register what has been tested with a given version of XWiki  
14:19 <vmassol> explain that the goal is to have a comprehensive view of all tests performed on Xwiki before it's released  
14:20 <vmassol> sburjan: you should rename the "space" column  
14:20 <vmassol> to "Category"  
14:20 <sburjan> ok  
14:20 <vmassol> sburjan: if I go to http://test.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Annotations+Tests/AddAndDeleteAnnotations I don't have any link to the automated test?  
14:21 <sburjan> vmassol: nope, they are only marked as autoamted, we didn't had the link yet  
14:21 <sburjan> still thinking about the best way to do this  
14:21 <vmassol> ok  
14:21 <vmassol> feedback: on http://test.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Annotations+Tests/WebHome  
14:22 <vmassol> the title shouldb't be "WebHome" but "Annotation Tests"  
14:22 <vmassol> and it's missing a parent  
14:22 <sburjan> ok, gonna fix that for all the spaces  
14:22 <vmassol> yes  
14:22 <vmassol> just remove the title  
14:22 <vmassol> or set it  
14:22 <sburjan> ok  
14:22 <vmassol> setting it might be better because we want to make title mandatory at some point I gather  
14:23 <sburjan> okay, will do ;)  
14:23 <vmassol> if I go to http://test.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Annotations+Tests/WebHome  
14:23 <vmassol> I can click on "add test" even when not logged in!!!!  
14:23 <chalx> has quit  
14:24 <sburjan> vmassol: what do you see in the modal ?  
14:24 <sburjan> no message about logging in ?  
14:24 <vmassol> try it  
14:24 <vmassol> the button is visible and can be clicked  
14:25 <vmassol> just test if( $hasEdit) if you wish any registered users to be able to add new tests or $hasAdmin if you want only admins to do that  
14:25 <vmassol> also  
14:25 <vmassol> s/also//  
14:26 <vmassol> you need to do that everywhere  
14:26 <vmassol> (do that = check rights)  
14:27 <vmassol> stupid question: why do you name a test with a "test" prefix? we know it's a test...  
14:27 <vmassol> like: http://test.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Workspace+Tests/testAcceptInvitation  
14:27 <vmassol> why not "Accept Invitation"  
14:27 <vmassol> ?  
14:28 <vmassol> sometime you do that and sometime you don't, it's confusing and not consitent  
14:28 <vmassol> sometime your test name starts with uppercase and sometimes not  
14:28 <vmassol> personally I'd have used human-readable names  
14:28 <vmassol> as in :  
14:29 <vmassol> "Add and Delete Annotations" instead of "AddAndDeleteAnnotations"  
14:29 <vmassol> you know that we can use whitespaces in page names :)  
14:30 <vmassol> If I were to add a new test I wouldn't know how to name since the current names are a mess  
14:30 <sburjan> vmassol: you wanted to map manual tests to autoamted tests. usually the tests which start with "test" are either automated OR they are renamed like this because of the convention I think we had about naming tests :)  
14:30 <vmassol> I never said that  
14:30 <vmassol> I said to map the categories  
14:30 <vmassol> and again I told you that the test anmes are not good  
14:31 <sburjan> one year ago we had a discussion  
14:31 <vmassol> you do need to have a link  
14:31 <vmassol> but not in the user friendly name  
14:31 <vmassol> (that's bad)  
14:31 <vmassol> the link is a technical link  
14:31 <vmassol> well you could have the exact name but:  
14:31 <vmassol> 1) you need the same naming conventions with manual tests  
14:32 <vmassol> 2) what happens when the test is renamed on the java side  
14:33 <sburjan> ok, I see. I'll remove the "test" prefix from all the tests  
14:34 <vmassol> regarding the sync  
14:34 <vmassol> you could do as I do for the Syntax Report  
14:34 <vmassol> and import once per day automated tests  
14:35 <vmassol> (and remove tests that don't exist - or move them to a removed tests category)  
14:35 <vmassol> for the syntax reporet I get the tests from jenkins  
14:36 <vmassol> http://rendering.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Main/SyntaxReport  
14:36 <vmassol> http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-rendering/lastSuccessfulBuild/testReport/api/xml?xpath=//suite/case/className%5Btext()%20=%20'org.xwiki.rendering.test.cts.RenderingTest'%5D/..&wrapper=root  
14:36 <sburjan> ok, I'll have to take a look on how you did it  
14:37 <sburjan> so the only technical name of a test should be in the automated Test Link ? (assuming the test is also automated)  
14:37 <vmassol> all rendering tests for ex: http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-rendering/lastSuccessfulBuild/testReport/api/xml?xpath=//suite/case/className/..&wrapper=root  
14:39 <vmassol> the only difficult part is that we don't have extra metadata for tests  
14:39 <vmassol> (this was my issue too for the syntax report so I had to provide extra metadata like test description, etc)  
14:39 <vmassol> anyway forget that FTM  
14:39 <vmassol> you should focus on manual tests IMO  
14:40 <sburjan> yes, I am going to start to rename them, remove the "test" prefix, add spaces, make them user friendly  
14:41 <vmassol> if you list automated tests you need to keep the link to the test somehow  
14:41 <sburjan> yes, this was the part I still need to think about it  
14:41 <vmassol> the very minimum is <class>.<test name>  
14:41 <vmassol> (it's not exactly enough but a good first approximation)  
14:43 <sburjan> I was thinking I should put the full URL to github where the test method is located. At least this is how I imagined it  
14:43 <sburjan> but again, if we move a test ....  
14:43 <vmassol> yes that's even better  
14:43 <vmassol> that's why the test import is a good solution IMO  
14:44 <vmassol> full class name + test name is enough actually  
14:44 <vmassol> and you have that in the jenkins data  
14:44 <vmassol> for ex: http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-rendering/lastSuccessfulBuild/testReport/api/xml?xpath=//suite/case/className/..&wrapper=root  
14:44 <vmassol> <className>org.xwiki.rendering.block.BlockTest</className>  
14:44 <vmassol> <name>testInsertChildBefore</name>  
14:44 <sburjan> I see. looks as a nice automated solution, which is good  
14:45 <vmassol> now we need to question whether it's useful to see all automated tests listed or not  
14:45 <vmassol> whether it's worht it  
14:45 <vmassol> and what's our goal  
14:45 <vmassol> for me the goal is that manual tests must not redo what automated tests do, that's all  
14:45 <vmassol> not sure listing them all achieves this or helps that mich  
14:45 <vmassol> \*much  
14:45 <sburjan> I agree  
14:46 <sburjan> My goal is to see which test is NOT automated so I can write an automated test for it :)  
14:46 <vmassol> yes but listing all existing tests won't help  
14:46 <sburjan> i agree  
14:46 <vmassol> IMO you should start by listing only manual tests  
14:47 <vmassol> don't bother with automated tests  
14:47 <vmassol> just add a link to all automated test reports  
14:47 <sburjan> ok  
14:47 <vmassol> I'm sure we can have that easily with our nemo instance  
14:48 <vmassol> (that's another story)  
14:48 <sburjan> yes  
14:48 <sburjan> vmassol, so to summarize, for the moment the next steps are:  
14:48 <sburjan> 1) Fix the not logged user having the "Add Test" button  
14:48 <sburjan> 2) Remove the "test" prefix from tests and make tem prettier  
14:48 <sburjan> 3) For automated tests, add link to All Automated Tests Reports from Jenkins  
14:48 <vmassol> 1) no  
14:48 <vmassol> it's a lot more general  
14:48 <vmassol> everywhere  
14:48 <vmassol> for ex the "management" button too  
14:48 <vmassol> etc  
14:48 <sburjan> yes  
14:48 <vmassol> there are lots of places  
14:49 <vmassol> I'd say remove automated tests for 3)  
14:49 <vmassol> (you can move them to another hidden space if you don't want to loose your work in case it's useful someday  
14:49 <vmassol> )  
14:50 <sburjan> so effectively remove the automated tests from the application ?  
14:50 <vmassol> yes  
14:50 <sburjan> so they don't show up anymore ?  
14:50 <vmassol> they're not useful right now  
14:50 <sburjan> ok, got it  
14:50 <sburjan> ther eis only one thing. some of them might fail on IE browsers for example, this is why I decided not to remove them in the first place  
14:51 <sburjan> because all the automated run on FF, but maybe we want to test them on IE9  
14:51 <vmassol> ok  
14:51 <vmassol> makes sense  
14:51 <sburjan> and there is a possibility they will fail on IE9..  
14:51 <vmassol> then keep them  
14:51 <sburjan> ok  
14:51 <vmassol> just add a field to link them  
14:52 <vmassol> to the automated test then  
14:52 <sburjan> ok  
14:53 <sburjan> so overall are you happy about it ?  
14:53 <vmassol> don't know yet  
14:53 <vmassol> haven't used it  
14:53 <vmassol> so far it's not useful  
14:53 <vmassol> since it's not been used yet  
14:53 <vmassol> I'll wait for my judgment till I see it used for real :)  
14:53 <vmassol> but it's promising  
14:53 <msmeria> vmassol: I've used it for 2 full tests
